text: Robert Burrowes, D.D. was an Anglican priest in Ireland during the second half of the 18th and the first half of the 19th centuries.Fryde, E. B.; Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I., eds. (1986). Handbook of British Chronology (3rd, reprinted 2003 ed.). Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. Burrowes was educated at Trinity College, Dublin."Alumni Dublinenses : a register of the students, graduates, professors and provosts of Trinity College in the University of Dublin (1593-1860)" Burtchaell, George Dames/Sadleir, Thomas Ulick (Eds) p118 Dublin, Alex Thom and Co, 1935 He was Rector of Cappagh; Archdeacon of Ferns from 1796 to 1798;"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 2" Cotton, H., p. 362, Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848-1878 then Master of the Royal School at Enniskillen; and Dean of Cork from 1819 "Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. pp243/4 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848-1878 until his death in 1841.National Archives ==References== Category:Deans of Cork Category:17th- century Irish Anglican priests Category:18th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:1841 deaths Category:Archdeacons of Ferns
title: Robert Burrowes (priest)
